page.title: 06BESTWOOD LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Bestwood is so named because it was the king's best wood.Bestwood was the hunting ground for kings for centuries.Richard 111 was hunting in Bestwood when he heard the news that Henry Tudor had landed in Wales with an invasion army. Charles 11 gave Bestwood to Nell Gwynne.Their son became the 1st. Duke of ST.Albans. The Leen Valley was a flashpoint of the industrial revolution.Cotton mills were set up along it.Two mills were in Bestwood,Forge Mill(site of an ancient forge)and Middle Mill. There wasn't a village of Bestwood until 1878 when the first colliers houses were built.The village grew as the mine became more important.The mine was closed in 1962.
